API_Description: Moves a page from one position to another within the document.
API_Description_Reason: The method name 'movePage' suggests functionality related to changing the position of a page within the document.
Returns: A boolean indicating success or failure of the operation.
Returns_Reason: Typically, methods that perform an action like moving a page return a boolean to indicate whether the operation was successful.

nPage.description: The 0-based index of the page to move.
nPage.description_reason: To move a page, the method needs to know which page to move, hence an index is required.
nPage.type_reason: Page indices are usually represented as numbers.

nLocation.description: The 0-based index of the new location for the page.
nLocation.description_reason: The method needs to know where to move the page, so a target index is necessary.
nLocation.type_reason: Page indices are usually represented as numbers.
